roleset.name: attach tightly, physically or metaphorically.

example.name: Oh my, how very harlequin
example.text: She was bound by her corset to the frame.

example.name: Metaphorical. This is what happened after the previous example.
example.text: He was bound by a recognizance to not communicate with his ex-girlfriend.
example.arg: to not communicate with his ex-girlfriend.
example.note: It's difficult to decide in teh metaphorical cases if laws/regulations should be arg0 or arg3, I think here's it's closer to a cause than the thing bound with, so I'd go with arg0.

roleset.note: Roleset based on instances in BOLT P01, parts 2,3. Framed by Claire. Verbnet entries 9.8 and 22.3-2-1, Framenet entry Attaching. Haven't seen this come up as an adj yet, but given the inconsistency in labeling past participles as either adjectives or verbs, here you go...

role.descr: thing that is likely (almost certain to require concatenation)

example.name: raising adjective, there's really only one likely event.
example.text: They 're bound to see sense and start making our streets safer instead of causing the trouble .
example.arg: [They] , [to see sense and start making our streets safer instead of causing the trouble . ]
